title: List of wadis of Kuwait
text: <a href="Kuwait">Kuwait</a> is part of the <a href="Tigris%E2%80%93Euphrates%20river%20system">Tigris–Euphrates river system</a> basin. Several Tigris–Euphrates <a href="confluence">confluence</a>s form parts of the Kuwait–Iraq border. Kuwait does not currently have any permanent rivers, but does have several <a href="wadi">wadi</a>s, the most notable of which is <a href="Wadi%20al%20Batin">Wadi al Batin</a>, which forms the border between Kuwait and Iraq. Kuwait also has several river-like marine channels around <a href="Bubiyan%20Island">Bubiyan Island</a>, most notably <a href="Khawr%20Abd%20Allah">Khawr Abd Allah</a> which is now an estuary, but once was the point where the <a href="Shatt%20al-Arab">Shatt al-Arab</a> emptied into the Persian Gulf. Khawr Abd Allah is located in southern Iraq and northern Kuwait, the <a href="Iraq-Kuwait%20border">Iraq-Kuwait border</a> divides the lower portion of the estuary, but adjacent to the port of <a href="Umm%20Qasr">Umm Qasr</a> the estuary becomes wholly Iraqi. It forms the northeast coastline of Bubiyan Island and the north coastline of <a href="Warbah%20Island">Warbah Island</a>.
